li.p: The City is proposing a Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) system along the Van Dorn/Beauregard corridor that will provide robust high-capacity transit operations between the Van Dorn Metrorail station, Shirlington Transit Center, Beauregard residential area and the Pentagon using a combination of dedicated and shared lanes. An overview of the proposed project and current study process was presented at the public kick-off meeting on May 22.

h2.a: Absentee Voting for June 10 Democratic Primary

li.p: On Tuesday, June 10, there will be a Democratic Primary for U.S. House of Representatives (8th Congressional District). The deadline to apply for an absentee ballot by mail is Tuesday, June 3 at 5 p.m. The last day to cast an absentee ballot in-person is Saturday, June 7 at 5 p.m. The Voter Registration Office is open for in-person absentee voting Monday-Saturday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. with extended hours (until 7:30 p.m.) on June 2 and June 3.

The City and Virginia Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) have once again partnered to bring “DMV 2 Go,” a mobile, full-service DMV customer service center to Alexandria. On Monday, June 9, the unit will park at City Hall from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Customers who have DMV transactions can skip the long lines and take care of them more quickly at the mobile unit.

The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning until 7:45 p.m. tonight.This storm is capable of producing damaging winds; residents are advised to move indoors to a sturdy building and to avoid windows.
Special issues and events in the City of Alexandria.
Historic boutiques and art galleries; unique restaurants and outdoor dining; historic, state of the art, and pet-friendly hotels; events and activities for the whole family.
Alexandria Visitor's Center, Alexandria's rich history, museums, and historic attractions.

h2.a: Virginia's Hurricane Preparedness Sales Tax Holiday

li.p: Get ready for hurricane season--and save. Virginians who shop for products such as batteries, food storage containers, generators, first aid kits, bottled water, radios, and other preparedness products between May 25-31 can do both! During that time, shoppers won't pay sales tax on many useful items that cost up to $60, or on generators costing $1,000 or less.

On the latest episode of the Mayor Euille Today show, Alexandria Mayor William D. Euille speaks with Yon Lambert and Brian Lawrence from Transportation & Environmental Services (T&ES) about spring and summer Maintenance projects and Resource Recovery programs; and with T&ES Director Rich Baier, and ACVA President & CEO Patricia Washington about the best ways to get to and around Alexandria.

h2.a: City Council Adopts $636.8M Fiscal Year 2015 Budget

li.p: On May 1, the Alexandria City Council voted to adopt a $636.8M General Fund Operating Budget for FY 2015. The budget includes a half-cent increase in the real estate tax rate, and increased water and electric utility tax rates for commercial and industrial properties. It also includes an increased transfer to ACPS, continuation of the Elderly and Disabled Tax Relief and Senior Taxi programs, and expansion of rent relief for the elderly.

On April 22, Alexandria Mayor William D. Euille delivered his annual State of the City address which outlines the City's accomplishments, opportunities and challenges. The address was delivered at City Hall prior to the regular City Council legislative meeting.

h2.a: Register for Spring & Summer Recreation Programs

li.p: Registration for Spring & Summer 2014 classes and activities is now open! The Program Guide features a variety of summer camps and new programs such as fishing, babysitting training, self-defense, trips and more!

The City clears snow from more than 560 lane miles of roadway, 20 miles of City-owned walkways and trails, and 44 acres of municipal parking lots or City-owned squares. Roads are plowed by priority , with primary and snow emergency routes cleared first, followed by secondary routes and then residential streets.

The City of Alexandria does not operate any public utilities. The following companies providing service in Alexandria are regulated as utilities. Similar services may also be available from other providers.

Residents are advised that during the evening of Sunday, Nov. 17, there will be increased traffic in area of W. Braddock Road near Kenwood Avenue, due to funeral services for Ronald Kirby, Transportation Planning Director for the Washington Metropolitan Council of Governments.

h2.a: Severe Thunderstorm Warning in Effect until 4:30 pm

li.p: The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for the City of Alexandria until 4:30 pm. Move indoors to a sturdy building; stay away from windows.

h2.a: Shop at the City's Farmers' Markets

li.p: Enjoy the season's fresh fruits, vegetables, baked goods, and more at Alexandria's farmers' markets! On weekends, the Market Square and Del Ray markets are year round on Saturdays; the West End Farmers' Market and the Four Mile Run Farmers' and Artisans Market are open on Sundays, May through November .

Make your wedding an historic occasion. Steeped in romance and authentic charm, Alexandria offers a variety of distinctive sites from colonial to contemporary, on land or sea, in beautiful buildings or the great outdoors.
Alexandria welcomes motorcoaches with free parking and all the resources necessary for a successful Alexandria visit.

h2.a: One Eastbound Lane of Edsall Road Remains Closed

li.p: One eastbound lane of Edsall Rd. between S. Van Dorn and S. Reynolds Streets remains closed due to water main break-related repairs. Motorists are advised to use alternate routes.

h2.a: Edsall Rd. Closed Due to Water Main Break Repairs

li.p: Edsall Road between S. Van Dorn St. and S. Reynolds St. will remains closed for completion of repairs related to yesterday's water main break. Motorists are advised to avoid the area.
